<p>
U. S. FRIGATE WABASH, 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=cadiz" rel="city">Cadiz</a>, Dec. 21, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1871">1871</a>. 
</p><p>
Dear Brother : 
</p><p>
I have had a good chance to visit Madeira, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=cadiz" rel="city">Cadiz</a>, 
Xeres, and Seville, and now we proceed to Gibraltar, 
where I shall leave the ship and go to Malaga, Granada, 
Cordova, Toledo, Madrid, Saragossa, and Barcelona. 
Thence we shall cross the Pyrenees into France at Pepignan, Marseilles, and Nice, to rejoin the ship. I can then 
learn if Admiral Alden can in the ordinary course of 
his duty go to Naples, Syracuse, Malta, and <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=alexandria" rel="city">Alexandria</a>, 
in which case I can see the Valley of the Po, the Mont 
Cenis tunnel, etc., to <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=rome" rel="city">Rome</a> and Naples in time to join 
the ship at, say, Naples. . . . 
</p><p>
Truly, etc., 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=wts" rel="me">W. T. SHERMAN</a>. 
</p>
